subject: Relationships
title: Bride Price: Buying a Wife
description: A micro-lesson that makes Bride Price: Buying a Wife usable.

hook.text: In parts of sub-Saharan Africa, a groom pays the bride's family in cattle, cash, or goods. No payment, no wedding.

buildup.text: Bride price exists in 75% of African societies. It compensates the bride's family for losing a productive member.

discovery.text: Supporters say it honors the bride's value. Critics say it commodifies women and traps them in bad marriages.

twist.text: Modern bride price has inflated so much that many young men can't afford to marry at all, delaying family formation.

climax.text: Whether dowry or bride price, turning marriage into a financial transaction changes who can marry and on what terms.

punchline.text: Bride price honors or commodifies â€” depending on who holds the power.
